Pabrik Satelit di Antariksa Segera Terwujud
03 Nov 2019, 22:25 by Fino Yurio Kristo, Fino Yurio Kristo - detikInet


Ilustrasi. Foto: Made In Space

Jakarta - Perusahaan Made In Space bersiap membangun satelit tak lagi di Bumi, tapi di antariksa. Hal itu bisa memulai era baru mesin otonom menghasilkan produk di Bulan, bahkan di Mars.Dikutip detikINET dari Space.com, proses manufaktur di luar angkasa bisa menghemat biaya dan menghindari kerumitan mengirim barang dari Bumi. Tak perlu lagi pusing memikirkan komponen yang terlalu berat dibawa roket atau jika ada struktur yang rentan rusak saat peluncuran ke angkasa.Made In Space sedang menguji teknologinya dalam proyek Archinaut One yang dibiayai USD 73,7 juta oleh NASA. Rencananya digelar pada tahun 2022, akan dicetak 2 panel tenaga surya sepanjang 10 meter untuk dipasangkan di pesawat antariksa. "Ini bukan hanya demonstrasi teknologi akan tetapi sudah menunjukkan kapabilitas penuh," ujar Justin Kugler, Vice President Made In Space.Di International Space Station (ISS), juga sudah ada perangkat printer 3 Dimensi untuk membuat komponen tertentu. NASA sendiri berencana mendaratkan manusia di Bulan pada tahun 2024, kemudian ke Mars.Teknologi manufaktur antariksa pun tak menutup kemungkinan diimplementasikan di sana. "Seperti itulah kami melihat manufaktur di antariksa pada masa depan," tutur Raymond Clinton, Associate Director NASA."Kami akan menuju permukaan Bulan untuk mendemonstrasikan teknologi yang diperlukan ketika kami akan pergi ke Mars. Itu adalah tahap selanjutnya," pungkas dia.Simak Video "Jatuh dari Langit, 'Satelit' Samsung Mendarat di Permukiman Warga"[Gambas:Video 20detik](fyk/fay)

Satellite factories in space will soon be realized
03 Nov 2019, 22:25 by Fino Yurio Kristo, Fino Yurio Kristo - detikInet


Illustration. Photo: Made In Space

Jakarta - Made In Space company is preparing to build satellites no longer on Earth, but in space. That could start a new era of autonomous machines producing products on the Moon, even on Mars. Quoted from Space.com, the manufacturing process in space can save costs and avoid the hassle of sending goods from Earth. No need to bother thinking about components that are too heavy to carry rockets or if there are structures that are vulnerable to damage when launching into space. Made In Space is testing its technology in the Archinaut One project, funded by USD 73.7 million by NASA. The plan is to be held in 2022, 2 solar panels will be printed along 10 meters to be mounted on a spacecraft. "This is not just a demonstration of technology but has already shown full capability," said Justin Kugler, Vice President of Made In Space. At the International Space Station (ISS), there are also three-dimensional printer devices to make certain components. NASA itself plans to land humans on the Moon in 2024, then to Mars. Space manufacturing technology did not rule out the possibility of being implemented there. "That's how we see manufacturing in space in the future," said Raymond Clinton, Associate Director of NASA. "We will head to the surface of the Moon to demonstrate the technology needed when we will go to Mars. That is the next stage," he concluded.
